Posts.Content: My husband was diagnosed in 2009 at age 60 and his case may be similar to yours. Try searching by my username to see past posts on this forum. I also posted his story on yananow--search for Bob Doiordonti. If you click on "experiences" on that site you can see cases listed by PSA level, gleason, treatment, age, location, etc. Pretty cool.
Posts.Signature: Husband's (Bob's) DRE in late 2008 at age 60: Elongated nodule, L side PSA: 1998, 2003, 2008, 2009, 2010, 4/11, 10/11 --- 0.4 0.4 0.5 0.6 0.4 0.5 0.6 2009: 1/12, R lat apex, G6, 5% 2010: no Gleason, R mid, HGPIN; R lat mid, atypical 2011: 2/12, R lat apex, G6, 2% and R mid, G6 2% Prostate size: normal @ 25 g After Dr. Fred Lee's opinion in 11/2011, decided to stop annual biopsies unless there's a jump in PSA level. Will continue semiannual PSAs.
Posts.Title: Low psa but yes, I have prostate cancer
